trans-unit.source: Introduction to Azure machine virtual backup
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Azure machine virtual backup

trans-unit.source: An introduction to backing up virtual machines in Azure using the Azure Backup service
trans-unit.target: An introduction to backing up virtual machines in Azure using the Azure Backup service

trans-unit.source: Azure virtual machine backup - Introduction
trans-unit.target: Azure virtual machine backup - Introduction

trans-unit.source: This section provides an introduction to using Microsoft Azure Backup to protect your Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This section provides an introduction to using Microsoft Azure Backup to protect your Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: By reading it you’ll learn about:
trans-unit.target: By reading it you’ll learn about:

trans-unit.source: How Azure virtual machine backup works
trans-unit.target: How Azure virtual machine backup works

trans-unit.source: The procedure to back up your Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: The procedure to back up your Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: The prerequisites to achieve a smooth backup experience
trans-unit.target: The prerequisites to achieve a smooth backup experience

trans-unit.source: The typical errors encountered and how to deal with them
trans-unit.target: The typical errors encountered and how to deal with them

trans-unit.source: The list of unsupported scenarios and how to influence changes to the product
trans-unit.target: The list of unsupported scenarios and how to influence changes to the product

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure virtual machines quickly, see the <link><linkText>Virtual Machine documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure virtual machines quickly, see the <link><linkText>Virtual Machine documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Why backup the Azure virtual machine?
trans-unit.target: Why backup the Azure virtual machine?

trans-unit.source: Cloud computing enables applications to execute in a scalable and highly available environment – which is why Microsoft developed Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Cloud computing enables applications to execute in a scalable and highly available environment – which is why Microsoft developed Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The data generated from these Azure virtual machines is important, and requires backup for safekeeping.
trans-unit.target: The data generated from these Azure virtual machines is important, and requires backup for safekeeping.

trans-unit.source: Typical scenarios that require data to be restored from backups are:
trans-unit.target: Typical scenarios that require data to be restored from backups are:

trans-unit.source: Accidental or malicious deletion of files
trans-unit.target: Accidental or malicious deletion of files

trans-unit.source: Corruption of the virtual machine during a patch update
trans-unit.target: Corruption of the virtual machine during a patch update

trans-unit.source: Accidental or malicious deletion of the entire virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Accidental or malicious deletion of the entire virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Data can be backed up from these virtual machines in two distinct ways:
trans-unit.target: Data can be backed up from these virtual machines in two distinct ways:

trans-unit.source: Back up the individual sources of data from within the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Back up the individual sources of data from within the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Back up the whole virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Back up the whole virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Back up of the entire virtual machine is popular because it is far simpler to manage and it also facilitates easy restores of the entire application and operating system.
trans-unit.target: Back up of the entire virtual machine is popular because it is far simpler to manage and it also facilitates easy restores of the entire application and operating system.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup can be used for in-guest data backup or backup of the complete virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup can be used for in-guest data backup or backup of the complete virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The business benefits of using Azure Backup for virtual machine backup are:
trans-unit.target: The business benefits of using Azure Backup for virtual machine backup are:

trans-unit.source: Automation of the backup and recovery workflows for your virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Automation of the backup and recovery workflows for your virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Application-consistent backups to ensure that recovered data starts from a consistent state.
trans-unit.target: Application-consistent backups to ensure that recovered data starts from a consistent state.

trans-unit.source: No downtime involved during virtual machine backup.
trans-unit.target: No downtime involved during virtual machine backup.

trans-unit.source: Windows or Linux virtual machines can be backed up.
trans-unit.target: Windows or Linux virtual machines can be backed up.

trans-unit.source: Recovery points are available for easy restore in the Azure Backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Recovery points are available for easy restore in the Azure Backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Automatic pruning and garbage collection of older recovery points.
trans-unit.target: Automatic pruning and garbage collection of older recovery points.

trans-unit.source: How does Azure virtual machine backup work?
trans-unit.target: How does Azure virtual machine backup work?

trans-unit.source: To back up a virtual machine, first a point-in-time snapshot of the data is needed.
trans-unit.target: To back up a virtual machine, first a point-in-time snapshot of the data is needed.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup service initiates the backup job at the scheduled time, and triggers the backup extension to take a snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup service initiates the backup job at the scheduled time, and triggers the backup extension to take a snapshot.

trans-unit.source: The backup extension coordinates with the in-guest VSS service to achieve consistency, and invokes the blob snapshot API of the Azure Storage service once consistency has been reached.
trans-unit.target: The backup extension coordinates with the in-guest VSS service to achieve consistency, and invokes the blob snapshot API of the Azure Storage service once consistency has been reached.

trans-unit.source: This is done to get a consistent snapshot of the disks of the virtual machine, without having to shut it down.
trans-unit.target: This is done to get a consistent snapshot of the disks of the virtual machine, without having to shut it down.

trans-unit.source: After the snapshot has been taken, the data is transferred by the Azure Backup service to the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: After the snapshot has been taken, the data is transferred by the Azure Backup service to the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: The service takes care of identifying and transferring only the blocks that have changed from the last backup – making the backups storage efficient.
trans-unit.target: The service takes care of identifying and transferring only the blocks that have changed from the last backup – making the backups storage efficient.

trans-unit.source: When the data transfer is completed, the snapshot is removed and a recovery point is created.
trans-unit.target: When the data transfer is completed, the snapshot is removed and a recovery point is created.

trans-unit.source: This recovery point can be seen in the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: This recovery point can be seen in the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure virtual machine backup architecture</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure virtual machine backup architecture</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Linux virtual machines, only file-consistent backup is possible.
trans-unit.target: For Linux virtual machines, only file-consistent backup is possible.

trans-unit.source: Calculating protected instances
trans-unit.target: Calculating protected instances

trans-unit.source: Azure virtual machines that are backed up using Azure Backup will be subject to <link><linkText>Azure Backup pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Azure virtual machines that are backed up using Azure Backup will be subject to <link><linkText>Azure Backup pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The Protected Instances calculation is based on the actual size of the virtual machine, which is the sum of all the data in the virtual machine – excluding the “resource disk”.
trans-unit.target: The Protected Instances calculation is based on the actual size of the virtual machine, which is the sum of all the data in the virtual machine – excluding the “resource disk”.

trans-unit.source: You are not billed based on the maximum size supported for each data disk attached to the virtual machine, but on the actual data stored in the data disk.
trans-unit.target: You are not billed based on the maximum size supported for each data disk attached to the virtual machine, but on the actual data stored in the data disk.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the backup storage bill is based on the amount of data stored with Azure Backup, which is the sum of the actual data in each recovery point.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the backup storage bill is based on the amount of data stored with Azure Backup, which is the sum of the actual data in each recovery point.

trans-unit.source: For example, take an A2-Standard sized virtual machine that has two additional data disks with a maximum size of 1TB each.
trans-unit.target: For example, take an A2-Standard sized virtual machine that has two additional data disks with a maximum size of 1TB each.

trans-unit.source: The table below gives the actual data stored on each of these disks:
trans-unit.target: The table below gives the actual data stored on each of these disks:

trans-unit.source: Disk type
trans-unit.target: Disk type

trans-unit.source: Max size
trans-unit.target: Max size

trans-unit.source: Actual data present
trans-unit.target: Actual data present

trans-unit.source: OS disk
trans-unit.target: OS disk

trans-unit.source: 17GB
trans-unit.target: 17GB

trans-unit.source: Local disk / Resource disk
trans-unit.target: Local disk / Resource disk

trans-unit.source: 135GB
trans-unit.target: 135GB

trans-unit.source: 5GB (not included for backup)
trans-unit.target: 5GB (not included for backup)

trans-unit.source: Data disk 1
trans-unit.target: Data disk 1

trans-unit.source: 30GB
trans-unit.target: 30GB

trans-unit.source: Data disk 2
trans-unit.target: Data disk 2

trans-unit.source: 0GB
trans-unit.target: 0GB

trans-unit.source: The actual size of the virtual machine in this case is 17GB + 30GB + 0GB = 47GB.
trans-unit.target: The actual size of the virtual machine in this case is 17GB + 30GB + 0GB = 47GB.

trans-unit.source: This becomes the Protected Instance size that the monthly bill is based on.
trans-unit.target: This becomes the Protected Instance size that the monthly bill is based on.

trans-unit.source: As the amount of data in the virtual machine grows, the Protected Instance size used for billing also will change appropriately.
trans-unit.target: As the amount of data in the virtual machine grows, the Protected Instance size used for billing also will change appropriately.

trans-unit.source: The billing does not start until the first successful backup is completed.
trans-unit.target: The billing does not start until the first successful backup is completed.

trans-unit.source: At this point the billing for both Storage and Protected Instances will begin.
trans-unit.target: At this point the billing for both Storage and Protected Instances will begin.

trans-unit.source: The billing continues as long as there is any backup data stored with Azure Backup for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The billing continues as long as there is any backup data stored with Azure Backup for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Performing the Stop Protection operation does not stop the billing if the backup data is retained.
trans-unit.target: Performing the Stop Protection operation does not stop the billing if the backup data is retained.

trans-unit.source: The billing for a specified virtual machine will be discontinued only if the protection is stopped and any backup data is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The billing for a specified virtual machine will be discontinued only if the protection is stopped and any backup data is deleted.

trans-unit.source: When there are no active backup jobs (when protection has been stopped), the size of the virtual machine at the time of the last successful backup becomes the Protected Instance size that the monthly bill is based on.
trans-unit.target: When there are no active backup jobs (when protection has been stopped), the size of the virtual machine at the time of the last successful backup becomes the Protected Instance size that the monthly bill is based on.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: 1. Backup vault
trans-unit.target: 1. Backup vault

trans-unit.source: To start backing up your Azure virtual machines, you need to first create a backup vault.
trans-unit.target: To start backing up your Azure virtual machines, you need to first create a backup vault.

trans-unit.source: The vault is an entity that stores all the backups and recovery points that have been created over time.
trans-unit.target: The vault is an entity that stores all the backups and recovery points that have been created over time.

trans-unit.source: The vault also contains the backup policies that will be applied to the virtual machines being backed up.
trans-unit.target: The vault also contains the backup policies that will be applied to the virtual machines being backed up.

trans-unit.source: The image below shows the relationships between the various Azure Backup entities:
trans-unit.target: The image below shows the relationships between the various Azure Backup entities:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Backup entities and relationship</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Backup entities and relationship</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To create a backup vault
trans-unit.target: To create a backup vault

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click New > Data Services > Recovery Services > Backup Vault > Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click New > Data Services > Recovery Services > Backup Vault > Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions associated with your organizational account, choose the correct subscription to associate with the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions associated with your organizational account, choose the correct subscription to associate with the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: In each Azure subscription you can have multiple backup vaults to organize the virtual machines being protected.
trans-unit.target: In each Azure subscription you can have multiple backup vaults to organize the virtual machines being protected.

trans-unit.source: In Name, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.
trans-unit.target: In Name, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.

trans-unit.source: This needs to be unique for each subscription.
trans-unit.target: This needs to be unique for each subscription.

trans-unit.source: In Region, select the geographic region for the vault.
trans-unit.target: In Region, select the geographic region for the vault.

trans-unit.source: Note that the vault must be in the same region as the virtual machines you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: Note that the vault must be in the same region as the virtual machines you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: If you have virtual machines in different regions create a vault in each one.
trans-unit.target: If you have virtual machines in different regions create a vault in each one.

trans-unit.source: There is no need to specify storage accounts to store the backup data – the backup vault and the Azure Backup service will handle this automatically.
trans-unit.target: There is no need to specify storage accounts to store the backup data – the backup vault and the Azure Backup service will handle this automatically.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create backup vault</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create backup vault</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on Create Vault.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create Vault.

trans-unit.source: It can take a while for the backup vault to be created.
trans-unit.target: It can take a while for the backup vault to be created.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the status notifications at the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Monitor the status notifications at the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create vault toast notification</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create vault toast notification</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A message confirms that the vault has been successfully created and it will be listed in the Recovery Services page as Active.
trans-unit.target: A message confirms that the vault has been successfully created and it will be listed in the Recovery Services page as Active.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the appropriate storage redundancy option is chosen right after the vault has been created.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the appropriate storage redundancy option is chosen right after the vault has been created.

trans-unit.source: Read more about <link><linkText>setting the storage redundancy option in the backup vault</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about <link><linkText>setting the storage redundancy option in the backup vault</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List of backup vaults</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List of backup vaults</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the backup vault goes to the Quick Start page, where the instructions for backup of Azure virtual machines are shown.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the backup vault goes to the Quick Start page, where the instructions for backup of Azure virtual machines are shown.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual machine backup instructions in the Dashboard page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual machine backup instructions in the Dashboard page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: 2. VM Agent
trans-unit.target: 2. VM Agent

trans-unit.source: Before you can start to backup the Azure virtual machine, ensure that the Azure VM Agent is correctly installed on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Before you can start to backup the Azure virtual machine, ensure that the Azure VM Agent is correctly installed on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In order to backup the virtual machine, the Azure Backup service installs an extension to the VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: In order to backup the virtual machine, the Azure Backup service installs an extension to the VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: Since the VM agent is an optional component at the time that the virtual machine is created, you need to ensure that the checkbox for the VM agent is selected before the virtual machine is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: Since the VM agent is an optional component at the time that the virtual machine is created, you need to ensure that the checkbox for the VM agent is selected before the virtual machine is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Learn about the <link><linkText>VM Agent</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>how to install it</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the <link><linkText>VM Agent</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>how to install it</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: Backup of IaaS (V2) virtual machines is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Backup of IaaS (V2) virtual machines is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Backup of virtual machines with more than 16 data disks is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Backup of virtual machines with more than 16 data disks is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Backup of virtual machines using Premium storage is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Backup of virtual machines using Premium storage is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Backup of virtual machines using multiple NICs or in a load-balanced configuration is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Backup of virtual machines using multiple NICs or in a load-balanced configuration is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Replacing an existing virtual machine during restore is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Replacing an existing virtual machine during restore is not supported.

trans-unit.source: First delete the existing virtual machine and any associated disks, and then restore the data from backup.
trans-unit.target: First delete the existing virtual machine and any associated disks, and then restore the data from backup.

trans-unit.source: Cross-region backup and restore is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Cross-region backup and restore is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine backup using the Azure Backup service is only supported in select regions.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine backup using the Azure Backup service is only supported in select regions.

trans-unit.source: Check list of <link><linkText>supported regions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Check list of <link><linkText>supported regions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If the region you are looking for is unsupported today, it will not appear in the dropdown list during vault creation.
trans-unit.target: If the region you are looking for is unsupported today, it will not appear in the dropdown list during vault creation.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine backup using the Azure Backup service is only supported only for select Operating System versions:
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine backup using the Azure Backup service is only supported only for select Operating System versions:

trans-unit.source: Linux: The list of distributions endorsed by Azure is available here.
trans-unit.target: Linux: The list of distributions endorsed by Azure is available here.

trans-unit.source: Other Bring-Your-Own-Linux distributions also should work as long as the VM Agent is available on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Other Bring-Your-Own-Linux distributions also should work as long as the VM Agent is available on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server: Versions older than Windows Server 2008 R2 are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server: Versions older than Windows Server 2008 R2 are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Restoring a domain controller VM that is part of a multi-DC configuration is supported only through PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Restoring a domain controller VM that is part of a multi-DC configuration is supported only through PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Read more about <link><linkText>restoring a multi-DC domain controller</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Read more about <link><linkText>restoring a multi-DC domain controller</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: If there is any feature that you would like to see included, <link><linkText>send us feedback</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If there is any feature that you would like to see included, <link><linkText>send us feedback</linkText><title></title></link>.
